Specific Details: Heads of Housing Development and Planning Bill, 2019: Highlighted need to allow environmental non-governmental organisations to provide input to the pre-legislative process.
Subject Matter: Heads of Housing Development and Planning Bill, 2019: Highlighted need to allow environmental non-governmental organisations to provide input to the pre-legislative process.
Intended Results: Ensure the legislative process encourages public participation and involves rich, comprehensive debate to fully explore all issues in relation to this Bill.

Specific Details: Raised concerns with regard to the issues arising under new forestry licencing appeals procedures in relation to access to justice and Ireland's commitments under the Aarhus Convention. Highlighted importance of appropriate NGO and community representation on the Forestry Policy Group and the Project Woodlands Working Group. Provided information regarding the current forestry policy direction of travel, calling for an urgent need for change to ensure a sustainable future for forestry.
DPOs Lobbied: Pippa Hackett|Super Junior Minister|Department of Agriculture, Food and the Marine::Stiofán Nutty|Special Adviser|Department of Agriculture, Food and the Marine::Eamon Ryan|Minister|Department of Environment, Climate and Communications::Mick Wallace|MEP|European Parliament::Victor Boyhan|Senator|Seanad
Subject Matter: Raised concerns with regard to the issues arising under new forestry licencing appeals procedures in relation to access to justice and Ireland's commitments under the Aarhus Convention. Highlighted importance of appropriate NGO and community representation on the Forestry Policy Group and the Project Woodlands Working Group. Provided information regarding the current forestry policy direction of travel, calling for an urgent need for change to ensure a sustainable future for forestry.
Intended Results: Ensure that Irish forestry policies are in line with Aarhus Convention, inclusive of communities in relation to decision-making processes and are sustainable. Ensure that community and civil society representation in forestry dialogue is appropriate and makes the best use of our collective expertise and resources.

Specific Details: Access to Information on the Environment Regulations: highlighted issues regarding the public consultation process.
Subject Matter: Access to Information on the Environment Regulations: highlighted issues regarding the public consultation process.
Intended Results: Ensure useful and necessary links were provided in the public consultation material to assist the public in engaging in the consultation and having access to relevant information; ensure AIE Regulations are in compliance with access to environmental justice rights protected under the Aarhus Convention.

Specific Details: Appeals system for housing applicants
Subject Matter: Appeals system for housing applicants
Intended Results: Legislative change that would see the development of an independent appeals system.
Lobbying Activities: We are invited to speak at the Oireachtas Committee on Housing to present on the pre-legislative scrutiny on the general scheme of the Housing (Miscellaneous Provisions) Bill 2024 on the 30th May. In that meeting we advocated for an independent appeals mechanism for access to social housing. Following this meeting we had discussion with Senator Boyhan.  Senator Boylan raised the this as a Commencement Matter CM_428/24 in the Seanad. |Email|2-5
